text: https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Farstechnica.com%2Fsecurity%2F2023%2F10%2Factive-attacks-exploiting-ws_ftp-pose-a-grave-threat-to-the-internet%2F&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C1a725829e6b545f1a4ae08dbc5bbb7db%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638321182379490177%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C2000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=sX%2BB46OP0OqyTPbLaXj4MiPPWYorKtrMJu6qZgTfwYw%3D&reserved=0 CVE-2023-40044, as the vulnerability in WS_FTP Server is tracked, and a separate vulnerability tracked as CVE-2023-42657 that was patched in the same September 27 update from Progress Software, are both about as critical as vulnerabilities come. With a severity rating of 10, CVE-2023-40044 allows attackers to execute malicious code with high system privileges with no authentication required. CVE-2023-42657, which has a severity rating of 9.9, also allows for remote code execution but requires the hacker to first be authenticated to the vulnerable system. ---- Steve Yates ITS, Inc. -- You received this message because you are subscribed to the Google Groups "PatchManagement" group. To unsubscribe from this group and stop receiving emails from it, send an email to . To view this discussion on the web visit https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgroups.google.com%2Fd%2Fmsgid%2Fpatchmanagement%2FSN6PR08MB5517F120D03A64421344CF9EB7CAA%2540SN6PR08MB5517.namprd08.prod.outlook.com&data=05%7C01%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C1a725829e6b545f1a4ae08dbc5bbb7db%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638321182379490177%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C2000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=IwC0mVdou8znKQBCdjD2wWSgZZRUCkPpOtoYhumAzg4%3D&reserved=0. Link: None
